snippet: Ford and Chrysler reported double-digit overall gains, with Ford’s F-Series trucks jumping 31 percent and Chrysler’s Ram brand rising 24 percent.
abstract: Ford Motor Co reports robust 14 percent gain in American car sales in May 2013, to 246,000; General Motors reports tepid 3 percent gain with about 252,000 vehicles; Chrysler reports 11 percent sales increase, with more than 166,000 cars; industry is on track to sell more than 15 million vehicles in 2013; total industry May sales were 1.44 million, up 8.2 percent over May 2012.
lead_paragraph: Ford and Chrysler reported double-digit overall gains, with Ford’s F-Series trucks jumping 31 percent and Chrysler’s Ram brand rising 24 percent.

headline.seo: Auto Sales, Led by Trucks,  Jump  in May
headline.main: Ford Showing Its Vigor as Industry Recovers
headline.print_headline: Ford Showing Its Vigor as Industry Recovers

keywords.value: Sports Utility Vehicles and Light Trucks
keywords.name: subject
